section.para:
You can have a look or check out sample code from MyBatis repository on Google Code.
Java code
Config files
To run the sample just run MyBatisSampleTest.java with JUnit 4.

FooService acts as a transactional service. It starts and ends a transaction when any of its methods is called. Have a look to FooService.java to see how transactional behaviour is configured with the @Transactional attribute. This is just a sample, you can use any other way provided by Spring to demarcate your transactions.

FooServiceImpl.java is the FooService implementation and it just uses DAOs/mappers that Spring has injected during startup. You will notice that your code does not need to call any Spring or Mybatis methods.
The database access layer has been implemented using the three different techniques explanied in this manual. Have a look at context.xml.
